text: Diplotaxis sundingii is a species of flowering plants of the family Brassicaceae. The species is endemic to Cape Verde.Oromí, Martín, Zurita & Cabrera, 2005 : Lista preliminar de especies silvestres de Cabo Verde: Hongos, Plantas y Animales Terrestres. Gobierno de Canarias, Consejería de Medio Ambiente y Ordenación Territorial, p. 42 It is listed as a critically endangered plant by the IUCN. ==Distribution and ecology== Diplotaxis sundingii is restricted to the island of São Nicolau, where it occurs in mountainous zones in the east of the island, between 500 and 700 metres elevation. Its population size is estimated at less than 250 individuals. ==References== sundingii Category:Endemic flora of Cape Verde Category:Flora of São Nicolau, Cape Verde
title: Diplotaxis sundingii
